Message.Msg: Social media site on Yahoo could be very big!!! Yoohoo! could be a fine name for it. Imagine a Yoohoo! that has separate subject pages: dating, finance, politics, sports, innovative ideas, business offers including auctions and sales, and just plain socializing. Message.Title: How to make Yahoo search better?
Message.Msg: The most attractive function on Google is the news function. For example, if you search "Yahoo" on Google, on the first result page, you will find a link called "News for Yahoo", if you click that link, you could view all the latest media news about Yahoo. Apparently, Yahoo search or Bing search is missing this very important function which makes both Yahoo search and Bing search look very outdated. I believe that's the most important reason why most people likes Google search better than Yahoo search or Bing search. If Yahoo could push Bing search to add this function, Yahoo and Bing search might be able to grab at least 10% of the market share from Google IMHO. Please pass my post to Yahoo CEO, thanks!

Topic.Title: Yahoo at $17.68 - Up from $15.83 in one month!

Message.Msg: Maybe with the old Yahoo BOD and CEO you could be right with charting but the trend changing with YAHOO. Don't bet against this time, if you made money I can understand your point of view...but also lets say you got lucky. Charts aren't always infallible. According to a very interesting article published in the Stocks and Commodities Magazine (May 2009 issue), the failure rate of charts patterns has tripled in recent years, at least in the stock market. After studying 13,932 charts patterns spread over the years from 1991 to 2008, Thomas Bulkowski (THE expert in chart patterns) found out that these patterns are now 3 times more likely to fail than in the past! Patterns studied are diamonds tops and bottoms, double tops and bottoms (8 types of Adam et Eve combinations), triple tops and bottoms, rising and failing wedges, head and shoulders tops and bottoms (4 types of simple and complex), ascending, descending and simetrical triangles, and rectangle tops and bottoms. Excluded were broadening patterns (6 types) and scallops (4 types) because of the difficulty in determining where the breakout is. So, if you have found it more difficult to trade charts patterns the last several years, now you know why

Topic.Title: Yahoo Bought Back $200 Million in Stock Last Month. Wait Until They Really Start Buying!

Message.Msg: PS It’s worth noting that Yahoo might have been precluded from buying their stock until after they reported their earnings on October 21st. It’s possible they only started buying stock a couple of days after that on say October 25th. If true, they purchased 13 million shares of Yahoo on 10 trading days or 1.3 million shares a day. Over that time period, Yahoo’s been averaging about 20 million shares traded every day, so you’re talking 6.5% of the daily volume. Since then, Yahoo!’s price has ranged between $16.57 and $17.50. The average cost of the 13 million shares Yahoo bought was $16.87. If they kept buying at the same pace of 1.3 million shares a trading day, it would take them 23 weeks to buy back $2.8 billion in stock.

Message.Title: If insiders and institutions own 80% of this stock and Yahoo buys back 15% of the float then what?
Message.Msg: these large institutions are going to hold long term so that leaves only 5% of the float to trade on a daily basis. You then have to figure that 3% of the general public is a long term investor so that leaves you only about 20 million shares to trade. That could cause a short squeeze. jmho
